Question
========
A researcher is interested in the percentage of residents of the
Netherlands that sometimes feel unsafe in the street. She collects data
from a random sample of 81 individuals. In this sample, 37.5% answers
that they sometimes feel unsafe in the street. He wants to estimate the
95% confidence interval of this variable.  
  
Which is the critical z-value that corresponds to a 95% confidence
interval? Round to 2 decimals.

Answerlist
----------
* 1.99
* 1.96
* 2.58
* 2.33
* 2.98
* 2.64

Solution
========










Answerlist

* False
* True
* False
* False
* False
* False
